title: Stochastic Modelling of Coherent Phenomena in Strongly Inhomogeneous Media.

references.title: I 7,
references.raw: E. Amic, J. M. Luck, and T. M. Nieuwenhuizen, J. Phys. I 7, 445 (1997).

references.title: Kvantovaya Élektron.
references.raw: S. E. Skipetrov and S. S. Chesnokov, Kvantovaya Élektron. (Moscow) 25, 753 (1998).

references.title: The Monte Carlo Method (Nauka,
references.raw: I. M. Sobol’, The Monte Carlo Method (Nauka, Moscow, 1985) [in Russian].

references.title: The Monte-Carlo Methods in Atmospheric Optics (Springer,
references.raw: G. I. Marchuk, G. A. Mikhailov, M. A. Nazaraliev, R.  A. Darbinjan, B. A. Kargin, and B. S. Elepov, The Monte-Carlo Methods in Atmospheric Optics (Springer, Berlin, 1980).

references.title: Wave Propagation and Scattering in Random
references.raw: A. Ishimaru, Wave Propagation and Scattering in Random Media (Academic, New York, 1978; Mir, Moscow, 1981).

references.title: Wave Scattering in Complex Media: From Theory to Applications (Kluwer Academic,
references.raw: B. A. van Tiggelen and S. E. Skipetrov, Wave Scattering in Complex Media: From Theory to Applications (Kluwer Academic, Dodrecht, 2003).

abstract:
A procedure of numerical simulation for coherent phenomena in multiply
scattering media is developed on the basis of the juxtaposition of a Monte Carlo
stochastic method with an iterative approach to the solution of the Bethe-
Salpeter equation. The time correlation function and the interference component
of coherent backscattering are calculated for scalar and electromagnetic fields.
The results of simulation are in good agreement with experimental results, as
well as with theoretical results obtained by generalizing the Milne solution
